Description: Body sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery neck-amphora or trefoil-mouth oinochoe; white slip; exterior: painted decoration consisting of goat (head and tail missing) leaping to right; dot rosettes as filling ornament; below, band of billets between narrow lines above part of crescent band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by British School at Athens. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The goat will have formed part of a frieze of animals. For parallels regarding the decoration, see British Museum 1888,0208.54.b. from Tell Dafana.
The number '1' is written in faint ink on the exterior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Smith 2009 / East Greek Pottery in the Collection of the British School at Athens (p. 350, no. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.049)
